page.title: 13MEMORIES OF A 9O YEAR OLD
page.content: We visited an old lady who was born in Ironbridge but who moved to Abbots Bromley in 192O. She found it very quiet here with very little traffic. A horse and cart went to Uttoxeter and a bus to Burton once a week. Two men swept the village street and spread fresh straw every week. She closed her general store in the village more than twenty years ago. She served in her shop from 8am until 8pm. People were very poor but clean and she remembers that you did not have to lock your doors. Her house and the wood yard opposite were the first to have electricity in Abbots Bromley.
